The massive ape gave a low deep chuckle at his own brand of humor fixing you with a contemplative leer that unnerved you nearly as much as the ripe odor coming from his fur. You clamped your nose shut taking small gulps of air through your mouth noting as you did so that despite being outside the air near your face had quickly become humid and foul. You couldn't even begin to imagine just how much body heat and sweat the creature had to be putting off to have such a profound effect. As if in response to your thought several beads of moisture dripped into your open mouth causing you to gag.

His fur had a strong musky odor to it not unlike skunk but with a slightly fruity sickly sweet undercurrent that left you wondering if this was what durian smelled like. There was also a slightly eggy scent in the air, not emanating from his fur but definitely cloying to the air around him. For the first time you noticed the dull grey stripes on the crest of his head running down his ruddy back. You suddenly felt very certain you didn't want him to turn around.

"Y-you're a skunkape." You winced as the words blundered past your lips. It was beyond obvious and made you seem dim-witted and afraid. You were fairly certain you didn't want this beast thinking you were afraid.

info.brief_description: The Myths you've heard as a child are a bit different from what you remember...
info.description:
On your way home, you take a short cut and find a mythical creature of some sort. Any creature you can think of is in this story showing their gross side. These creatures aren't what you would expect.

Inspired by Smell of a Myth by Enigma, which itself is inspired by Mythical Land

Rules
1. Sexual content is fine with us.
2. The creatures can be in anyway gross. But no diarrhea, okay. That's just a step too far. No offense, but I'm not even a fan of scat, and I'm barely letting that slide. And no fire farts.
3. No death to the creatures nor the main character (you).
4. Be descriptive on what the creatures look like.
5. No females. This is a male predominant story. There are PLENTY others on this subject with females, but there are none here. Only unimportant humans can be female.
6. Its not easy too get out of a bad situation.
7. All the creatures can talk.
8. It's up to you whether this is sexual or not.
9. Macro is cool, but you don't change size.
10. Myths, furries, and scalies can be your friend or enemy.
11. All chapters must contain at least four sentences. C'mon, it's not that hard to be a little creative.
